coredata.dc:title: Online bookmakers' odds as forecasts: The case of European soccer leagues

abstract.ce:para: In this paper we examine the effectiveness of using bookmaker odds as forecasts by analyzing 10,699 matches from six major European soccer leagues and the corresponding odds from 10 different online bookmakers. We show that the odds from some bookmakers are better forecasts than those of others, and provide empirical evidence that (a) the effectiveness of using bookmaker odds as forecasts has increased over time, and (b) bookmakers offer more effective forecasts for some soccer leagues for than others. © 2009 International Institute of Forecasters.

item-info.copyright: Copyright 2010 Elsevier B.V., All rights reserved.

citation-title.titletext: Online bookmakers' odds as forecasts: The case of European soccer leagues

affiliation.organization: Faculty of Computer and Information Science
Faculty of Computer and Information Science

abstract.ce:para: In this paper we examine the effectiveness of using bookmaker odds as forecasts by analyzing 10,699 matches from six major European soccer leagues and the corresponding odds from 10 different online bookmakers. We show that the odds from some bookmakers are better forecasts than those of others, and provide empirical evidence that (a) the effectiveness of using bookmaker odds as forecasts has increased over time, and (b) bookmakers offer more effective forecasts for some soccer leagues for than others. © 2009 International Institute of Forecasters.
